newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican shares tumble on profit-taking.
newsitem.headline: Mexican shares tumble on profit-taking.

text.p: Mexican stocks ran out of steam on Friday after a week of record highs gave way to profit-taking, although stock prices made up some ground toward the close of trade after falling through support levels.
The IPC index of leading stocks fell 24.96 points or 0.74 percent to 3,364.37.
"The market was very weak. Most of the people paid to see what was going on and got out early," one floor trader said.
Traders said the fact that stocks bottomed out at the second resistance level of 3,332 points and rebounded was a good sign that stocks are consolidating in preparation to rise again.
But volume was very low at 62.57 million shares in 2,708 transactions. Losers outpaced gainers 51 to 31.

Benchmark Telmex ADRs fell 3/8 to 33-3/4 while in Mexico its L shares, the largest issue on the bolsa, fell 1.09 percent to 12.70 pesos ($1.69). Telmex A shares fell 1.25 percent to 12.62 pesos ($1.68).

Retailers took the biggest hit with Grupo Salinas y Rocha L shared topping the lists of losers by falling five percent or to 38 centavos (5 cents). Gigante B followed, off 4.44 percent to 2.58 pesos (34 cents) and Grupo Palacio de Hierro fell 3.85 percent to five pesos (67 cents).
On the list of top gainers, Elektra L shares picked up 12.50 percent to 18 pesos ($2.40) on one 30,000-share trade in the morning.
Sidek L shares gained 5.56 percent to 1.90 pesos (25 cents) and Ponder A posted its second straight day of solid gains, advancing 5.14 percent to 3.89 pesos (52 cents).
